title: Xóotsx̱ X̱ʼayaaḵuwdlig̱adi Shaawát / The Woman Who Married the Bear
author: Naakil.aan / Frank Dick Sr.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: X̱át x̱át aadé x̱aan kaduneegi yé aadé x̱aan dutlaagu yé áyá yá yá sh kalneek.
sentences.sentence_english: Me. This is the way it was told to me, the way this ancient story was told to me.

lines.line_tlingit: aadé x̱aan dutlaagu yé áyá yá

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Yú G̱unanaa áyá yá ḵu.oo yá dáaḵ ká Gunanaa.
sentences.sentence_english: These people, are Athabaskans, those living in the Interior, Athabaskans.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Áyá hasdu daat sh kalneek áyá.
sentences.sentence_english: And this story is about them.

sentences.sentence_tlingit: Yáadu á, yá yagiyee kakḵwanéek jinkaat yaawax̱ée yá dís aadé x̱aan kaduneegi yé yáx̱. Yú áyá kadunéek shuxʼaanáx̱ yá sh kalneek.
sentences.sentence_english: This is it; I will tell it today, the tenth day of the month, the way it was told to me. This story is how it was first told.

lines.line_english: This is it; I will tell it today,
the way it was told to me.
